name: Martha Copeland
description: '''Martha Copeland''' ({{circa|1891}}â€“1894; date of death unknown) was an American [[classic female blues]] [[singing|singer]]. She recorded 34 songs between 1923 and 1928. She was promoted by [[Columbia Records]] as "Everybody's Mammy", but her [[sound recording and reproduction|records]] did not sell in the quantities achieved by the Columbia recording artists [[Bessie Smith]] and [[Clara Smith]]. Apart from her recording career, little is known of her life.
